    • Uses of Simplifier in com.sri.ai.grinder.library.pretty

      Classes in com.sri.ai.grinder.library.pretty that implement Simplifier 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  IfThenElseConstantBranchesSimplifier
      Simplifies if C then true else D ---> C or D if C then false else D ---> not C and D if C then D else true ---> not C or D if C then D else false ---> C and D

      class  DistributeIntersectionOverUnionSimplifier
      Distribute intersection over union:
      class  ElementOfExtensionalSetSimplifier
      t ∈ {t1,…,tn} → (t = t1) ∨ t ∈ {t2,…,tn}
      class  ElementOfIntensionalUnionSimplifier
      t ∈ ∪i ∈ D:CΦ → ∃ i ∈ D : (C ∧ t ∈ Φ)
      class  ExtensionalSetEqualEmptySetSimplifier 
      class  IntensionalSetToConditionalSimplifier
      {{ (on Indices in Types) Head | Condition }} ---> C = evaluate(there exists Indices in Types : Condition) return IfThenElse.make(C, {{ (on Indices in Types) Head | Condition }}, {}, true)
      class  IntensionalUnionEqualToEmptySetSimplifier
      (∪i ∈ D:CΦ) = ∅ → ∀ i ∈ D : (¬C ∨ Φ = ∅)
      class  IntensionalUnionIntersectionEqualToEmptySetSimplifier
      (∪i ∈ D:CΦ) ∩ (∪i' ∈ D':C'Φ') = ∅ → ∀ i ∈ D : C ⇒ ∀ i' ∈ D' : C' ⇒ (Φ ∩ Φ' = ∅)
      class  IntensionalUnionToUnionsOfIntensionalSetsOfBaseTypeSimplifier
      We will have intensional unions, which we need to convert to unions of intensional sets of the base type (in the paper, tuples): Base case: Union( {{ (on I) { T } : C }} ) ---> {{ (on I) T : C }} Recursion: Union( {{ (on I) Set1 union ...
      class  IntersectionEmptySetSimplifier
      {} intersection Set ---> {}
      class  IntersectionExtensionalSetSimplifier
      Between an extensional set and another Set (either intensional or extensional, since it resorts to "in" that works for both): { e1, ..., e_m } intersection Set ---> (if e1 in Set then {e1} else {}) union ...
      class  IntersectionIntensionalSetsSimplifier
      {{ (on I1) H1 : C1 }} intersection {{ (on I2) H2 : C2 }} ---> {{ (on I1) H1 : C1 and evaluate(there exists I2 : C2 and H2 = H1) }}
      class  InversionSimplifier

      class  SetIntersectExtensionalSetEqualToEmptySetSimplifier
      S ∩ {t1,…,tn} = ∅ → (t1 ∉ S) ∧ (S ∩ {t2,…,tn} = ∅)
      class  UnionEmptySetSimplifier
      {} union Set ---> Set
      class  UnionOfSetsEqualEmptySetSimplifier
      S1 ∪ S2 = ∅ → S1 = ∅ and S2 = ∅

    • Uses of Simplifier in com.sri.ai.grinder.theory.differencearithmetic

      Classes in com.sri.ai.grinder.theory.differencearithmetic that implement Simplifier 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DifferenceArithmeticSimplifier
      A simplifier that rewrites numerical comparisons in difference arithmetic to equivalent ones in which terms are cancelled out and numerical expressions are summed together.

      class  LinearRealArithmeticSimplifier
      A simplifier that rewrites numerical comparisons in linear real arithmetic to equivalent ones in which terms are cancelled out and numerical expressions are summed together.
